intro: Semele pterygophora var. congeminata, commonly known as the Congo sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically features triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves, with small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along water bodies. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural applications.
